original_solution_mapping.L1: Each pan costs $10.00 to make so for 20 pans, it will cost 10*20 = $<<10*20=200.00>>200.00
original_solution_mapping.L2: She sells each of the 20 pans for $25.00 each so she will make 20*25 = $<<20*25=500.00>>500.00
original_solution_mapping.L3: She makes $500.00 and spent $200.00 on ingredients so she makes 500-200 = $<<500-200=300.00>>300.00

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7121.
    Returns: the amount Jenny makes after factoring in expenses.
    """
    # L1
    cost_per_pan = 10.00 # It costs Jenny $10.00 in ingredients to make 1 pan of lasagna.
    num_pans = 20 # sells 20 pans
    total_ingredient_cost = cost_per_pan * num_pans

    # L2
    sale_price_per_pan = 25.00 # at $25.00 apiece
    total_revenue = num_pans * sale_price_per_pan

    # L3
    net_profit = total_revenue - total_ingredient_cost

    # FA
    answer = net_profit
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Each pan costs ${cost_per_pan} to make so for {num_pans} pans, it will cost {cost_per_pan}*{num_pans} = $<<{cost_per_pan}*{num_pans}={total_ingredient_cost}>>{total_ingredient_cost}
She sells each of the {num_pans} pans for ${sale_price_per_pan} each so she will make {num_pans}*{sale_price_per_pan} = $<<{num_pans}*{sale_price_per_pan}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue}

She makes ${total_revenue} and spent ${total_ingredient_cost} on ingredients so she makes {total_revenue}-{total_ingredient_cost} = $<<{total_revenue}-{total_ingredient_cost}={net_profit}>>{net_profit}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Each pan costs $10 to make so for 20 pans, it will cost 10*20 = $<<10*20=200>>200
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She sells each of the 20 pans for $25 each so she will make 20*25 = $<<20*25=500>>500
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: She makes $500 and spent $20 on ingredients so she makes 500-20 = $<<500-20=480>>480

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'num_pans' (value: 20) was used instead of 'total_ingredient_cost' (value: 200.0).
